decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area. | The existing garage shall be kept continuously available for car parking, and prior to occupation of the development hereby permitted, space for parking of one car shall be provided in the front garden and kept contiguously available for car parking.  REASON:   To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site.
description: Three dormer extensions to rear roof and three rooflights to front roofslope of house
